metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9627 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The MP4_ReadBox_String function in modules/demux/mp4/libmp4.c in VideoLAN VLC media player before 2.1.6 performs an incorrect cast operation from a 64-bit integer to a 32-bit integer, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a large box size.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9627` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
libvlccore7 - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-data - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-nox - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-pulse - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1').
